plantType: Classify {{plantName}} by its dominant growth habit or planting form.
Return a single lowercase string chosen from: "plant", "flower", "bamboo", "shrub", "tree".
utility: List every practical or ornamental role {{plantName}} is commonly grown for.
Return an array of lowercase tags selected from: "comestible", "ornemental", "produce_fruit", "aromatic", "medicinal", "odorous", "climbing", "cereal", "spice".
comestiblePart: Identify which anatomical parts of {{plantName}} are safely edible.
Return an array whose values are limited to: "flower", "fruit", "seed", "leaf", "stem", "root", "bulb", "bark", "wood".
fruitType: Describe the fruiting category for {{plantName}} if it produces harvestable fruit.
Return an array containing any applicable values from: "nut", "seed", "stone". Use an empty array when the plant does not fruit.
seasons: Indicate the seasons when {{plantName}} looks most attractive or is at peak performance.
Return an array of capitalized season names chosen from: "Spring", "Summer", "Autumn", "Winter".
description: Write a cohesive horticultural overview for {{plantName}} that highlights appearance, growth habit, bloom/fruit interest, and essential care.
Use 150-300 words of prose (no bullet lists or headings) and keep the tone factual and neutral.
identity: Populate the `identity` object for {{plantName}} with authoritative taxonomy and naming information.

Include: `givenNames` (array of common names), `scientificName` (binomial), `family`, `overview` (2-3 sentence summary distinct from the main description), `promotionMonth` (1-12 where relevant), `lifeCycle` (Annual, Biennials, Perenials, Ephemerals, Monocarpic, or Polycarpic), `season` (array of capitalized seasons), `foliagePersistance` (Deciduous, Evergreen, Semi-Evergreen, or Marcescent), `spiked` (boolean), `toxicityHuman` and `toxicityPets` (Non-Toxic, Midly Irritating, Highly Toxic, or Lethally Toxic), `allergens` (array), `colors` (array of objects like {"name":"Deep Pink","hexCode":"#d62d5b"}), `multicolor` (boolean - REQUIRED: set to true if plant has multiple distinct colors, false otherwise), `bicolor` (boolean - REQUIRED: set to true if plant has exactly two colors, false otherwise), `scent` (boolean), `symbolism` (array of short themes), `livingSpace` (Indoor, Outdoor, or Both), `composition` (subset of Flowerbed, Path, Hedge, Ground Cover, Pot), and `maintenanceLevel` (None, Low, Moderate, or Heavy).

Use concise values grounded in reputable botanical sources and avoid copying the long-form description. Always explicitly set `multicolor` and `bicolor` boolean values based on the plant's actual color characteristics.
plantCare: IMPORTANT: You MUST populate ALL of these fields: `origin` (array of regions/countries where the plant originates - REQUIRED), `habitat` (array - choose from: Aquatic, Semi-Aquatic, Wetland, Tropical, Temperate, Arid, Mediterranean, Mountain, Grassland, Forest, Coastal, Urban - REQUIRED), `temperatureMax` (integer °C - REQUIRED), `temperatureMin` (integer °C - REQUIRED), `temperatureIdeal` (integer °C - REQUIRED), `levelSun` (exactly one of: Low Light, Shade, Partial Sun, Full Sun - REQUIRED), `hygrometry` (0-100 scale describing ambient humidity), `wateringType`, `division`, `soil`, `adviceSoil`, `mulching`, `adviceMulching`, `nutritionNeed`, `fertilizer`, and `adviceFertilizer`.

For watering, include both summary guidance and an explicit `schedules` array under `watering`, where every schedule entry is `{ "season": "Spring", "quantity": 2, "timePeriod": "week" }` describing how often to water.
Keep recommendations practical, specific, and consistent with the plant’s native environment.
growth: Detail the growth and propagation profile for {{plantName}}.

Fill: `sowingMonth`, `floweringMonth`, and `fruitingMonth` as arrays of integers (1-12); `height` and `wingspan` in centimeters; `tutoring` (boolean) with `adviceTutoring`; `sowType` (array of techniques such as direct_sow or trays); `separation` (centimeters between plants); `transplanting` (boolean); `adviceSowing`; and `cut` (short note on pruning or cutting style).
Use realistic numbers pulled from horticultural references.
usage: Summarize how people cook with, medicate with, or otherwise use {{plantName}}.

Populate: `adviceMedicinal` (concise paragraph on traditional medicinal uses if applicable), `nutritionalIntake` (array mentioning vitamins or benefits), `infusion` (boolean) with `adviceInfusion`, `infusionMix` (array of objects like {"mix_name":"Chamomile blend","benefit":"Calming digestive tea"}), `recipesIdeas` (array of short dish ideas), `aromatherapy` (boolean), and `spiceMixes` (array of blends).
If certain uses are not documented, leave their arrays empty instead of inventing data.
ecology: Capture {{plantName}}’s ecological value and environmental needs.

Set `melliferous` (boolean for nectar value), list `polenizer` helpers (Bee, Wasp, Ant, Butterfly, Bird, Mosquito, Fly, Beetle, ladybug, Stagbeetle, Cockchafer, dungbeetle, weevil), `beFertilizer` (boolean), `groundEffect` (erosion control, nitrogen fixing, etc.), and `conservationStatus` (Safe, At Risk, Vulnerable, Endangered, Critically Endangered, or Extinct).
Note wildlife relationships or restoration roles when credible data exists.
danger: List the main pests and diseases that threaten {{plantName}}.
Return two arrays: `pests` (common or scientific names) and `diseases` (named issues such as powdery mildew).
Only include issues that are well-documented for this species.
miscellaneous: Fill `companions` with names of plants that grow well alongside it, `tags` with short categorical labels users might search for, and `sources` with an array of citation objects shaped like {"name":"Royal Horticultural Society","url":"https://www.rhs.org.uk/"}.
Prefer high-quality references and avoid duplicates.
meta: When meta data is requested for {{plantName}}, only populate editorial helper fields.

Return an object that may include `funFact` (<=40 words of trivia), `adminCommentary`, `createdBy`, `updatedBy`, and timestamps if they are already known; leave review status untouched unless explicitly provided.
meaning: Summarize the symbolic meaning of {{plantName}} in under 50 words.
Focus on emotions, ceremonies, or cultural themes backed by botanical folklore. Do not include care advice or lists.
